result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy L Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must also have a psychological screening and cognitive intervention as well as vocational training. Defendant is to be evaluated for battered woman syndrome. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes: May be completed in the second year of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from ZCI - Incident Report
ZCI

Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  No contact with the victims, L.M.W. or L.H. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 6/14/16:  NO MIND ALTERING CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ATTEND 7 SELF HELP GROUPS PER WEEK, NA, AA OR A SECULAR MEETING.  VERIFIED BY SIGNED ATTENDANCE SHEETS AND TURN IN SHEETS TO ZCI.  ZCI TO TEST DEFENDANT WEEKLY.
